intro: Cyanella alba, commonly known as the white cyanella, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its compact, evergreen rosette of narrow, blue-gray leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in spring, adding a delicate touch to its appearance. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, Cyanella alba is often cultivated in arid and semi-arid regions.
